ccre.channel

Class EventStatus

  • java.lang.Object
    • ccre.channel.EventStatus
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EventInput, EventOutput, java.io.Serializable

    public class EventStatus
extends java.lang.Object
implements EventInput, EventOutput, java.io.Serializable
    An implementation of an EventInput. This can be fired using the .produce() method or by firing this event as an EventOutput.
    Author:
    skeggsc
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EventStatus()
      Create a new Event.
      EventStatus(EventOutput... events)
      Create a new Event that fires the specified events when fired.
      EventStatus(EventOutput event)
      Create a new Event that fires the specified event when fired.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clearListeners()
      Clear all listeners on this EventStatus.
      void event()
      Fire the event.
      boolean hasConsumers()
      Returns whether or not this has any consumers that will get fired.
      void produce()
      Produce this event - fire all listenering events.
      boolean produceWithFailureRecovery()
      Same as produce, but if an exception is thrown, the event will be DETACHED and reported as such!
      void send(EventOutput client)
      Register a listener for when this event is fired.
      void unsend(EventOutput client)
      Remove a listener for when this event is fired.

      • EventStatus

        public EventStatus()
        Create a new Event.

      • EventStatus

        public EventStatus(EventOutput event)
        Create a new Event that fires the specified event when fired. This is equivalent to adding the event as a listener.
        Parameters:
        event - the event to fire when this event is fired.
        See Also:
        send(ccre.channel.EventOutput)

      • EventStatus

        public EventStatus(EventOutput... events)
        Create a new Event that fires the specified events when fired. This is equivalent to adding the events as listeners.
        Parameters:
        events - the events to fire when this event is fired.
        See Also:
        send(ccre.channel.EventOutput)

    • Method Detail

      • hasConsumers

        public boolean hasConsumers()
        Returns whether or not this has any consumers that will get fired. If this returns false, the produce() method will do nothing.
        Returns:
        whether or not the produce method would do anything.
        See Also:
        produce()

      • produce

        public void produce()
        Produce this event - fire all listenering events.

      • produceWithFailureRecovery

        public boolean produceWithFailureRecovery()
        Same as produce, but if an exception is thrown, the event will be DETACHED and reported as such!
        Returns:
        If anything was detached.
        See Also:
        produce()

      • clearListeners

        public void clearListeners()
        Clear all listeners on this EventStatus. Only do this if you have a very good reason!
